title: Notable & Quotable: Saving the Senate
sub_head: ‘We don’t need a change of rules. The Senate needs a change of behavior.’
body:
Lamar Alexander (R., Tenn.), who is retiring at the end of this term, speaking on the Senate floor Dec. 2:

More than ever, our country needs a United States Senate to turn pluribus into unum, to lead the American struggle to forge unity from diversity. . . . Divided government offers an opportunity to share the responsibility—or the blame—for hard decisions, such as controlling the federal debt.
Now, some advocate another way to operate the Senate. End the filibuster, the Senate’s best-known tradition. Don’t worry about working across party lines. Pass everything with a majority vote.
Let the passions of the people roar through the Senate. If you’re a Democrat: Abolish right-to-work laws. Repeal limits on abortion. Pass restriction on guns.
